data.title: The Great Gatsby
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
data.description: A story of wealth, privilege, and unfulfilled dreams in the Roaring Twenties.

data.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
data.author: Harper Lee
data.description: A powerful novel addressing issues of race and morality in the American South.

data.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
data.author: Douglas Adams
data.description: A comedic journey through space, time, and absurdity.

data.title: Pride and Prejudice
data.author: Jane Austen
data.description: A timeless novel of love, class, and social manners in 19th-century England.

data.title: Brave New World
data.author: Aldous Huxley
data.description: A dystopian vision of a future society driven by pleasure and conformity.

data.title: The Catcher in the Rye
data.author: J.D. Salinger
data.description: The story of a young man's journey through the challenges of adolescence and society.
